s2.t7: 2013: 9 people, planned growth, expanding office space

s3.title: Mission
s3.t1: Turning research innovations into usable tools
s3.t2: Bring the latest technologies to the market, through development of tools that can be easily used and that seamlessly become a part of the standard workflow

s4.title: Vision
s4.t1: Be solid provider of products / services developed on top of the most recent technologies in the field of image analysis and data engineering

s5.t2: flexible system to incorporate partners' procedures if needed

s7.title: Image Analysis
s7.t2: General algorithms for patient specific applications
s7.t3: Novel approaches for image reconstruction and analysis
s7.t4: Technologies: machine learning, all major image-analysis frameworks, vmtk

s8.title: Vmtk
s8.t2: open source project with several hundreds users worldwide in major research environments
s8.t3: active mailing list and more than 200 daily unique visitors

s9.title: Data Engineering
s9.t2: Concurrent access to data, sensitive data
s9.t6: Real time from several sources, machine learning
s9.t8: No impact of size on performance
s9.t9: Technologies: functional programming, big data, visualization

s12.title: Product development
s12.t1: developed in collaboration with the European Institute of Oncology

s13.title: Product development
s13.t1: PROmoting patient SAFEty and quality improvement in critical care
s13.t3: in use in more than 300 Critical Care Units in Italy and Europe

s15.title: Service provision
s15.t1: tested on 63 patients with outstanding results

s16.title: Assets
s16.t6: From scratch and with already existing systems

s18.title: Fields of action
s18.t2: Dedicated applications tailored to specific needs
s18.t4: Distributed data/image collection and analysis for clinical trials and post-market activities

s20.title: Pharma
s20.t1: Ongoing development of a worldwide hybrid application for data collection, monitoring and on-site image analysis for patient-specific disease/treatment management

s21.title: Data intensive application
s21.t2: Non-linear constrained optimization for energy co-generation and consumption based on market, weather and environmental modeling
